data.name: 5 Guinea ESB
data.description: This classic British Extra Special Bitter utilizes all British ingredients including Marris Otter Malt for a slightly malty and nutty finish.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: The Phoenix Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Phoenix opened in in April 2014 and features our handcrafted beers along with regional beers, wines and spirits in our restored 1914 mortuary.

breweries.name: Microbrasserie La Diable
breweries.description:
In the charming surroundings of the Tremblant Ski Resort, at the foot of the slopes, we invite you to live a ‘devil-icious’ adventure at the Microbrewery La Diable!

Since December 1995, we have been welcoming adventurers galore who want to get to know our craft beers that are creating a stir in Québec. At your service, our friendly staffers are among the most congenial in the province’s brew pubs.

Whether it’s with friends, a group visit or just a taste in good company, the Microbrewery La Diable promises you an outing you’ll remember!

data.name: Abbot Ale
data.description:
Abbot Ale is brewed in Bury St. Edmunds – a place which enjoys a rich brewing heritage than can be traced back almost 1000 years.
 

The famous Domesday Book includes a passage about 'cerevisiarii' or ale brewers as servants of the Abbot in Bury St Edmunds' Great Abbey. The Greene King brewery sits alongside the historic ruins of the Abbey and to this day our brewers still draw water from the same chalk wells used by their brewing predecessors all those years ago.
Hailed by the late beer writer Michael Jackson as "one of the great characters of the beer world", Abbot Ale is brewed for quality of the highest order. Abbot is an irresistible ale with masses of fruit characters, a malty richness and superb hop balance. It is brewed longer to a unique recipe, which makes it the full-flavoured, smooth and mature beer it is today.

Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

data.name: Adnams Ghost Ship
data.description: At 4.5% abv, this Pale Ale has a good assertive pithy bitterness and a malty backbone. It is brewed with a selection of malts – Pale Ale, Rye Crystal and Cara – we use Citra, and a blend of other American hop varieties to create some great citrus flavours

breweries.name: Adnams Brewery
breweries.description: Adnams is one of England's oldest and most respected breweries, but despite its rich heritage and enduring fame, Adnams is not a company willing to rest on its laurels. Its continued commitment to quality and innovative packaging designs has made it Britain's fastest growing brewery over the last two years. To top it off, Adnams' head brewer was recently chosen as Britain's Brewer of the Year by a panel of his peers. The aggressive team at Adnams is raring to go and keen to make a mark in the U.S.

data.name: Adnams May Day
data.description:
This is a well balanced malty golden 5.0% abv beer with a crisp bitterness, leading to a satisfyingly clean finish and a hint of orange peel and spice. Brewed with East Anglian Pale Ale malt, malted wheat and English hops to produce a well-balanced malty beer with a crisp bitterness leading to a satisfying clean finish.

Brewed to mark the start of the British summer and the warmer drinking occasions.

data.name: Adnams New Zealand Pale Ale
data.description:
This is a crisp, dry, blonde beer with fantastic goosberry flavours and a green cirtus aromas. It is brewed with pale ale and pale crystal malted barley and hopped with Nelson Sauvin.

New Zealand Pale Ale is the latest in our World Beers series. We first used Nelson Sauvin hops in our Celebratory Ale, William Godell, in 2009. We love the green citrus aromas that this hop provides.

This hop variety is grown on New Zealand’s South Island and it adds fantastic gooseberry flavours to the beer similar to a Sauvignon Blanc. New Zealand has been producing some fantastic hop varieties for many years but the aroma of Nelson Sauvin is truly unique in the hop world.”

breweries.name: Abbeydale Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

data.description:
Carefully selected hops are 
 blended to brew this full 
 flavored English pale ale.

breweries.name: Run of the Mill Public House and Brewery
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Run of the Mill Public House
breweries.description:
The Run of the Mill Public House & Brewery is a 14 barrel brew pub specializing in hand-crafted beer and casual pub fare. All of our beers flow directly from our brewery.  We use only the finest imported malts and domestic hops available to bring you the tastiest and finest selection of beers.

Owner Geoff Houghton renovated an abandoned Mill and made it a place where business men and women meet, families gather and friends hang out.

In addition to our house-made beers, we have an eclectic Pub menu featuring home made food. Our talented chefs serve delightful appetizers, wraps, sandwiches, vegetarian fare, hearty entrees and imaginative daily specials.  Come in make yourself at home and enjoy a fresh brew and meal.
We are located on Saco Island in Saco Maine.  From Memorial Day to Labor Day come enjoy our outdoor seating and bar overlooking the Saco River, we offer a grill menu and raw bar.

data.name: Alfred's Honey Golden
data.description: A pale straw-coloured ale, a perfect easy drinking ale for those hot summer days.

breweries.name: Adkin Brewery
breweries.description:
The Adkin Brewery was originally founded as a hobby in early 2000.  It is a true example of a small cottage brewery, and is run by the sole proprietor, Mr Shaun Cunningham, from the garage attached to his house on a housing estate in Wantage, Oxfordshire.  All of Shaun's beers are produced using only natural ingredients, most of which are supplied by Best Mates Brewery, Ardington and Ken Thomas of Arkwright's Homebrew in Highworth, near Swindon, Wiltshire www.arkwrightshomebrew.com.

At the moment, Shaun still has a full-time job.  Despite the restrictions placed upon Shaun in terms of both time and space, you can see from the photographs just how much can be achieved in a small, basic garage.  As for the quality of the products, well, that speaks for itself!

data.name: Alfred's Jewel
data.description:
A pale straw - coloured tasty ale, hopped with American Liberty hops.

The perfect easy drinking session ale.

data.name: All Sewn Up
data.description: An English Pale Ale made especially for the Lucero Family Picnic. Brewed with Target hops, a UK variety, All Sewn Up has a restrained bitterness with a bit of earthiness and spiciness. Made to be enjoyed throughout the show. Named after a song on Lucero's self-titled album.

data.name: Apparition Ale
data.description: This English pale ale features ingredients imported from the U.K. This beer is driven by malt flavors of caramel and toast, earthy and herbal hop aroma, along with a fruity English ale yeast character.

breweries.name: Moon River Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Moon River Brewing Company is founded on our obsession with creating the ideal restaurant and brewery experience. Striving for this ideal, we are committed to providing three basic services. We are dedicated, first and foremost, to providing you with a comfortable and relaxing environment with prompt and cheerful service. Secondly, we are committed to serving you a delicious variety of freshly prepared foods. Our kitchen is a boiling pot of diversity, offering a range of dishes from simple comfort food to eclectic gourmet cuisine. Finally, we are undeniably passionate about serving great beer.

data.name: Arbutus Pale Ale
data.description: British style ale with a crafty west coast attitude, our pale ale is light in body with a subtle lingering hop character. Arbutus also has detectable notes of dry stone fruit and persistent toasted malt.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale

Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. breweries.name: Craig Street Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Welcome to the Craig Street Brew Pub!

We are a locally owned and operated business and we offer fresh hand-crafted brews, local house-made food and top-notch customer service.

We love the environment!
We recycle all paper, tin, glass and plastics.
We use biodegradable garbage bags.
We compost daily.
We have reduced our waste by 75,000 kg so far.
Our fryer oil is recycled into Biodiesel.
We offer a complimentary shuttle on weekends.
We offer a variety of celiac-friendly food!
Our mash from each brew feeds the local pigs!
We sponsor tons of community organizations.
We use energy efficient products.
We use biodegradable cleaners.
We buy from local businesses.
We buy with environmental consciousness.

breweries.name: Abbeydale Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

data.name: Auld Acquaintance
data.description: Warming dark amber ale, light spice aroma rich malt flavours and a full bodied finish.

breweries.name: Trophy Brewing Company
breweries.description: Trophy Brewing Co. represents Chris Powers and David “Woody” Lockwood’s long-held dream of having their own brewery. A place where they can take ideas about and for beers, scratched down on napkins over late night drinking sessions, and turn them into a reality. Trophy is not big, we feature a 3 BBL brewhouse with 3 single batch and 2 double batch fermenters; but what does come out of those tanks; we take pride in.

data.name: Baker Street Ale
data.description: A malty, easy drinking English Pale Ale with moderate bitterness. The Maris Otter malt provides a delicious contrast to the UK East Kent Goldings hops that give way to smooth and delicate floral and spicy overtones, while the English Ale yeast leaves a residual malty sweetness with a clean finish.
data.foodPairings: Roast chicken and pork, fish and chips, mild cheese (Lancashire or Leicester) and oatmeal raisin cookies.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Full Moon Brewery
breweries.description: The Full Moon Brewery specializes in British and Irish style beers. We use Marris Otter malt as our base and then add various combinations of Black Patent, Brown malt, Crystal malt, and Roasted Barley depending on the individual beer. We use Fuggles, East Kent Golding and Challenger hops. Our brew house is a one barrel RIMS system filling one and two barrel fermenters.

breweries.name: Beck's Brewery
breweries.description:
Beck's Brewery (Brauerei Beck & Co) is a brewery in the north German city of Bremen. Owned by local families until February 2002, it was then sold to Interbrew  for 1.8 billion euros. The brewery was formed under the name Kaiserbrauerei Beck & May o.H.G. on 27 June 1873, by Lüder Rutenberg (8 February 1816 ? 14 June 1890), Heinrich Beck, and Thomas May. On 1 October 1875, Thomas May left the brewery which then became known as Kaiserbrauerei Beck & Co.

Beck's ranks number 5 among Germany's best selling breweries.

data.name: Bellrinnger
data.description: Notably hoppy ale which is light to medium-bodied, clean-tasting, refreshingly dry, with a balancing sweetness. Citrus, pale malt aroma and dry, bitter finish. Consistent. Amber gold in colour.

breweries.name: Abbey Ales Brewery
breweries.description:
Founded in 1997, Abbey Ales is the first and only brewery in the historic City of Bath for over forty years, and is the initiative of experienced brewery sales and marketing manager Alan Morgan.

Bellringer is the only cask beer continuously produced at the Abbey Brewery, a golden 4.2% abv best bitter.

Successfully launched at the Bath CAMRA beer festival in October 1997 Bellringer is now the top selling cask bitter in the World Heritage City of Bath and is as popular with the many visitors to the Georgian City as it is with Bathonians.

data.name: Bilbo's Bitter Baggins
data.description: English pale ales are classified on a scale starting with Ordinary Bitters (very low ABV and IBU; designed for very easy drinking), then Best Bitters (typically between 4.2% and 4.7% ABV), and finally, Extra Special Bitters (aggressive flavors with balanced hops and malt). This beer is a Best Bitter that is showcasing mid-range drinkability with a well-balanced malt and hop character. We used Marris Otter and Victory malts giving this a traditional biscuit-y malt flavor. We then used traditional Golding and Fuggle UK hops which are earthier than their American counterparts. We then dry hopped using Australian Helga hops which are known for their delicate herbal notes. She was then all topped off with a British yeast.

Located 10 minutes north of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, our micro brewery and taproom is striving to bring a world class experience to every person who walks through our doors.

With a hospitality philosophy of treating our customers like they're guests in our home, we look forward to serving you.

breweries.name: Drafting Table Brewing Company
breweries.description: Drafting Table Brewing Company (DTBC) is located in the Village Center Area of Wixom, Michigan.  Through a culmination of 4 years of professional brewing and 8 years of homebrewing experience DTBC seeks to provide artisan craft beer to lovers of ales and lagers around Metro-Detroit.  By uniting selective combinations of ingredients with meticulous brewing practices we keep a high standard for the beer we produce.  In addition to ales and lagers, we serve Detroit native Faygo soda and small snacks.  We encourage guests to bring in food from our surrounding restaurants or even from their own kitchen since we do not have a kitchen. We look forward to providing you with a product we are proud to make in an atmosphere that makes you want to come back.

data.name: Blackbeard Ale
data.description: The original pirates ale, perfected over twenty years in the islands. A full bodied flavor yet won't fill you up, excellent with any activity a pirate would enjoy...no macrame' or fluffy pillow shopping guys. Steaks on the grille, pizzas, ribs or any snacks (no quiche either) will go great with the original Blackbeard Ale!

data.name: Blind Salamander
data.description:
Blind Salamander Pale Ale is the first of a series of Rahr beers called Rare Breed. These beers are dedicated to improving the lot of endangered Texas species. Rahr is making donations from these proceeds to the Texas Parks & Wildlife Foundation to help with the recovery of these species.

The Texas Blind Salamander is a rare cave-dwelling troglobite amphibian native to San Marcos, specifically the San Marcos Pool in the Edwards Aquifer. It has bright red external gills for absorbing oxygen from the water. Its mature length is 5 cm and its diet varies by what flows into its cave, including shrimp, snails and amphipods.

breweries.name: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The story of Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. really starts when Fritz Rahr graduated from Texas Christian University. Fortunately for beer lovers in North Texas, Fritz not only fell in love with Fort Worth, but also fell in love with his future wife here. And in another fortuitous twist for all of us, Fritz’s wife, Erin, gave him the thumbs up when he announced that he would like to carry on the Rahr family tradition of brewing.

Fritz and Erin founded Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. in the fall of 2004. In five years, the brewery has more than doubled its brewing capacity - from 2,000 barrels per year to over 5,000 barrels per year and has won fifteen nationally-recognized awards, including a Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup for Bucking Bock and 2009 National Grand Champion from the United States Beer Tasting Championships for Iron Thistle.

breweries.name: Two Henrys Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Two Henrys Brewing Company brews modern and traditional hand-crafted beer styles in small batches in Plant City, FL. Because local and small is just better.

With our beers we celebrate Florida’s short history and people that made our great state possible. We strive to make great beers and sneak in a Florida history lesson whether you want it or not. 

Our beers can be found at our tasting room starting on or about October 1, 2013 and select bars and restaurants in the Tampa Bay area. In the meantime, read about our coming beers and namesakes ,the Two Henrys, below…or don’t.

breweries.name: Pig Pounder Brewery
breweries.description: The Pig Pounder Brewery is named after a beer launched by the Darryl's restaurant chain in 1988. It is a local microbrewery specializing in producing outstanding authentic UK style beers including types like an Extra Special Bitter, an English Dark Mild, and a classic Milk Stout, for local venues. The brewery also features an interactive tasting room, made for connecting with our guests and educating them more about beer.

breweries.name: Port Townsend Brewing Company
breweries.description: The original Port Townsend Brewing Company was one of the largest and longest operating breweries of its time. It was capitalized at $25,000 and established September 5, 1905 by George Watkins, Michael Hartman and N.W. O'Rear. Ernest Studerus, a well-known citizen at the time, served as brewmaster. The site of the old brewery was on the west side of Monroe Street between Water and Washington Street which now houses the Athletic Club.

data.name: Brooklyn Summer Ale
data.description: Brooklyn Summer Ale is a modern rendition of the "Light Dinner Ales" brewed in England throughout the 1800's right up until the 1940's. They were also called "luncheon ales" or even "family ales", because they were refreshing and flavorful without being too heavy. We brew our Brooklyn Summer Ale from premium English barley malt, which gives this light-bodied golden beer a fresh bready flavor. German and American hops lend a light crisp bitterness and a citrus/floral aroma, resulting in a beer with a very sunny disposition.
data.foodPairings: Excellent with salads, seafood, quiches, lightly spicy dishes, cheddar and feta. It’s also great at brunch.

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale

data.name: Bust Head English Pale Ale
data.description: Brewed in the tradition of an English Pale Ale, but infused with the spirit of new American craft brews, our flagship beer is drinkable, balanced, and enjoyable year-round. Additions of Goldings, Fuggle, and Cascade hops provide our pale ale with the aroma of floral hop tones, as well as imparting a refreshing, clean bitterness. Our use of caramel malt in the grain bill balances out our generous hop additions, and provides the beer with a smooth and bready backbone. Perfectly balanced, it’s our brewmaster’s favorite beer!

breweries.name: Shipyard Brewing
breweries.description: Since 1994, Shipyard Brewing Company has been brewing fine quality products with a wide range of style profiles. We use only top quality ingredients and pride ourselves on the consistency and freshness of our products. All our beer is hand crafted from recipes developed by master brewer Alan Pugsley, one of the most influential people in the craft brewing movement in North America.  Shipyard is available in 35+ states around the country and markets for our freshly brewed, hand-crafted beers continue to expand.

breweries.name: Kaktus Brewing Company
breweries.description:
This is a nano-brewery 
​​Producing 500 barrels yearly 
With 6-to-8 beers on tap

We shipped in German Made equipment to set ourselves apart in the local industry allowing us to specialize in lighter style lager beers while keeping the favorites such as Porter's, ESB's, IPA's and other classic Ales.  
​​
​O​ur reverse osmosis water purifier allows us to control the quality of water during each and every brew. ​​​
​
​Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.

data.name: Chukkar English Pale Ale
data.description: Hallertauer hops from the Yakima Valley of Washington State give this English style pale ale its distinctive flavor and hoppiness. A large amount of malted barley is used in the brewing process which gives Chukkar Ale a full, rich body.

breweries.name: The Kernel Brewery
breweries.description: The brewery springs from the need to have more good beer. Beer deserving of a certain attention. Beer that forces you to confront and consider what you are drinking. Upfront hops, lingering bitternesses, warming alcohols, bodies of malt. Lengths and depths of flavour. We make Pale Ales, India Pale Ales and old school London Porters and Stouts towards these ends. Bottled alive, to give them time to grow.

breweries.name: Aarhus Bryghus
breweries.description:
Aarhus Brewery makes special beer for enjoyment! That is to say that art is not so advanced as to result in afskræmmende and can only be drunk by connoisseurs. Anyone who wants to try something new, you will find joy in Aarhus Brewery products.

Aarhus Brewery makes special beer with between 5 and 9% alcohol, bottled in large 60 cl bottles. There will be a beer which will be suitable as an aperitif beer, which beer will be suitable for fish and meat dishes light, and there will be dark, heavy and bulky beers, which are suitable for meats and cheeses.

It builds both fixed beers and varying seasonal beers. Read more in products.

The brewery is purely a production brewery that produces beer and brave this in bottles and kegs. There is not affiliated catering to the brewery. On the other hand we do tours for small groups of between 15 and 75 people.

data.name: Classic Session Ale
data.description: The definition of a session beer, this 3.9% perfectly balanced English Pale Ale will keep you coming back for more. A slightly biscuity malt backbone supports the earthy English hops to provide great drinkability from the keg or from the cask!
data.foodPairings: Pairs perfectly with a roast beef and cheese sandwich, while sitting outside in a beer garden.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Fortnight Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We believe that beer is a social beverage and good beer should be enjoyed with good friends. That is why we aim to bring a line of clean easy-drinking English inspired ales that everyone can enjoy to the Triangle area in late 2013. 

We love beer with extreme flavors or high alcohol content as much as the next guy, but that's not for everyone, which is why we will be producing extremely balanced and flavorful beers at a lower alcohol level that will be easily approachable and everyone will be able to find a beer that they enjoy in our lineup.

Fortnight Brewing is a true partnership of local and English flavors. The company's ownership consists of both English citizens and North Carolina natives, and our beers will utilize premium English malts and hops as well as locally-grown ingredients. 

Fortnight Brewing will be located in Cary NC with plans of opening in Summer or Fall of 2013. Keep your eyes open for a list of upcoming tasting events at your favorite area bottle shops, bars and restaurants!

data.name: Comeragh Challenger Bitter
data.description:
Comeragh Challenger was first brewed for the Irish Craft Beer Festival which was held at the RDS in Dublin and after positive feedback was on tap again at festivals in Cork and Galway this year. Due to the positive reaction it received and thinking how ideal it would be as a summer tipple, Head Brewer Cormac O’Dwyer decided to release a bottled version as the ‘Brewer’s Select’ summer beer for 2012.
Traditionally, English bitters are made with the very hard water profile which occurs at Burton-on-Trent, the home of brewing in England. In West Waterford, the hard water profile means flavours of the English bitter style can be replicated. Coupled with this, the beer is hopped solely with Challenger hops, an English hop used in many traditional bitters. At 3.8%, this is an easy-drinking beer that will be perfect for summer barbeque days!

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Dungarvan Brewing
breweries.description:
Dungarvan Brewing Company was launched in April 2010 after a couple of years spent researching, planning and developing by the four founders.
The philosophy of the brewery is one of purity — we keep the beer in its purest form by bottle-conditioning it. It isn’t filtered, isn’t pasteurised and is naturally carbonated so there is minimum interference with it between raw ingredients and finished product. We always start with the best quality ingredients including; Maris Otter malt, full leaf hop cones and the limestone rich water of West Waterford.
Our brewer strives for quality and consistency across every stage of the brew, working hard to ensure that each bottle achieves the high standards he has set. All the beers are craft brewed in small batches and by its artisan nature this can lead to slight variations by batch.
The brewhouse is a 6bbl plant made by PBC Brewery Installations, the UK’s top micro brewery installer and is ideally suited to the bottle-conditioned traditional ales that we brew.
Bottling is currently done by hand with a four-head filler with plans to upgrade this to an automated system in the coming months.

data.name: Continental Pale Ale
data.description: Our take on an English style Pale Ale.  Copper in color, perfectly balanced; malty with enough hops to balance the beer.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale

Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. breweries.name: Burwood Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Burwood Brewing Company is a local craft brewery in the heart of the Walla Walla wine region. The owners, David and Jennifer Marshall, bring with them a wealth of experience and knowledge regarding the operation of a brewery. David is a veteran brewer with 10 years of experience in professional brewing and Jennifer has 4 years of experience in office administration and marketing for a brewery. They have a passion to bring high quality craft beers to Walla Walla, WA.

David and Jennifer’s goals are simple; produce great beer for the region in which they live and love so much as well as to offer a cozy and friendly space where their creations can be experienced and enjoyed.

data.name: Coriander Ale
data.description: This 1831 recipe is a mild, pale ale of a biscuity base with notes of citrus and peppercorn. Hot peppers provide a slight finish of peppery warmth to cure what ails you.
